column2: During the reign of the monarchy, a cluster of villages scattered on the hills of Rome became a city in the Latium region.
The beginning of the period dates back to 509 BC, the year of the founding of the Republic according to Roman tradition and the expulsion of the last queen of Rome, Lucius Tarquinius Superbus.
Ancient Rome today has several different periods, the Roman Republic, the Roman Empire, the Eastern Roman Empire and the Western Roman Empire.
Ancient Rome is the name of the culture and empire that grew out of the city-state of Rome in Italy from the 8th century BC to the 5th century AD.
Ancient Rome is considered to be the continuation of ancient Greek culture - Hellenism - and together they both form the basis of Western culture.
